meanings.definition: To exceed in range or extent.
meanings.sent1: The rocket outranges all other spacecraft in speed.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to outrange her competitors in the race.
meanings.sent3: The cheetah outranged the tortoise in the sprint race.
meanings.sent4: His ambition to outrange his own limits led him to great success.
meanings.sent5: The eagle's wings outrange those of any other bird, allowing it to soar high.

meanings.definition: To go beyond the limits of.
meanings.sent1: The floodwaters outrange the banks of the river during heavy rains.
meanings.sent2: The explorer dared to outrange the known territories and venture into the unknown.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to outrange the fence and escape into the neighbor's yard.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness always manages to outrange any negativity around her.
meanings.sent5: The artist's creativity outranges conventional boundaries, leading to unique masterpieces.

meanings.definition: To surpass in distance or scope.
meanings.sent1: The new telescope outranges all others in its ability to see distant galaxies.
meanings.sent2: His passion for exploration constantly drives him to outrange his previous adventures.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner managed to outrange his own personal record by a significant margin.
meanings.sent4: Her voice effortlessly outranges the other singers in the choir.
meanings.sent5: The mountain peak outranges all others in the range, standing tall and majestic.
